definitions.definition: Something which is bought; a purchase.
definitions.example: At only $30, the second-hand kitchen table was a great buy.

definitions.definition: To obtain (something) in exchange for money or goods
definitions.example: I'm going to buy my father something nice for his birthday.
I've bought material comfort by foregoing my dreams.
He tried to buy me with gifts, but I wouldn't give up my beliefs.

definitions.definition: To be equivalent to in value.
definitions.example: The dollar doesn't buy as much as it used to.

definitions.definition: To accept as true; to believe
definitions.example: I'm not going to buy your stupid excuses anymore!

definitions.definition: To make a purchase or purchases, to treat (for a meal)
definitions.example: Let's go out for dinner. I'm buying.

definitions.definition: To make a bluff, usually a large one.
definitions.example: Smith tried to buy the pot on the river with a huge bluff
